newsitem.title: USA: Computer Products buys Jeta Power Systems.
newsitem.headline: Computer Products buys Jeta Power Systems.

text.p: Computer Products Inc said on Tuesday it acquired privately-held Jeta Power Systems Inc, a Huntington Beach, California-based designer, manufacturer and marketer of medium and high wattage power systems.

Computer Products, which manufacturs electronic subsystems for power conversion, said it bought Jeta for $11.7 million. Computer Products previously held about 10 percent of Jeta's common stock and acquired the remaining 90 percent in exchange for $11.25 million in cash, the company said.
Jeta designs, manufactures and markets medium to high power systems in the 400 watt to 4 kilowatt range for applications in the telecommunications, networking, computing and instrumentation markets.
